2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is going to a pub to watch a game and hopes that Alexander White and Jacob Walker will be there.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (a)

        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor is currently at a pub watching a game and hoping to see Alexander White and Jacob Walker.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely relax and enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps participating in their conversations and activities.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

      How many players acted so far this stage

      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!

      Alice Lewis: 0.8
      Alexander White: 0.3333333333333333
      Jack Taylor: 0.6666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 1.0

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor just arrived at Victoria Park to join friends for a relaxing afternoon. Later that evening, he and his friends plan to watch the Luxembourg versus Israel game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently relaxing with friends in a park.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely participate in conversations and activities with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.

          Query
        • Jack Taylor, Jack Taylor arrived at Victoria Park to meet friends and will be watching the Luxembourg versus Israel game later.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Jack Taylor to consider right now. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Red Lion. They are also aware of the following:Has comfortable seating and a warm, inviting atmosphere.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely relax and enjoy the company of his friends, perhaps participating in their conversations and activities.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Answer: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking disco ball of joy, their enthusiasm a glitter bomb that explodes in every conversation, making even traffic jams feel like a party.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is enjoying a sunny afternoon in Victoria Park with friends. He is looking forward to watching a soccer game with them later.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a relaxed and social setting with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"

        TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.

          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Red Lion.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00 - 15 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones enjoys spending time with friends in Victoria Park and watching football games at pubs, particularly The Red Lion.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest going to The Red Lion to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Red Lion pub later that night.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently relaxing with friends before going to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "

          Answer: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park to join her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are planning to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Red Lion pub later that night.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social person who enjoys spending time with her friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub for the group to watch the game together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would try to find a solution that works for everyone in the group.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

        • 2015-05-15 10:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They plan to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Query
        • Alice Lewis, Alice Lewis arrived at Victoria Park to meet her friends, William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They plan to watch a soccer game later that evening.
          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

      • Current time

        • 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, sorry I'm late.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
      Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
      Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
      William Jones -- "How about The Red Lion? They have good beer and plenty of TVs.
      Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
      Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
      William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alexander White is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends at Victoria Park and will be joining them later that evening to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game at The Red Lion pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely suggest The Black Swan as the pub to watch the game.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a sociable person who enjoys watching football in pubs with friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a pleasant social situation.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this, knowing that Alexander White wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely suggest going to The Red Lion with his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alexander White likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alexander White -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value

        Observation

      • Observation
          Key

        • Observation
          Value
        • [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Question: Summarize the statements above.

          Query

          Final chain of thought

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Scene 3 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    William Jones -- premise: The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alexander White -- premise: If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Red Lion
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Red Lion
      Context for action selection and components

        • Act
          Value
        • The Red Lion
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends and enjoy the game.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Black Swan
          (b) The Red Lion
          Answer: (b)
        ObservationSummary
      • Summary of recent observations
          Key
        • Summary of recent observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes to see some friends there, but is fine with going regardless.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub. ', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.', '[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jack Taylor is heading to the pub to watch a game and hopes to see some friends there, but is fine with going regardless.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends to watch the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jack Taylor would likely participate in conversations and activities with his friends.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If William Jones comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alice Lewis comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jack Taylor is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor would love to share the excitement of the game with Alexander White, creating a lasting memory.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is hoping Jacob Walker will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jack Taylor?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

          Time

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        Question_3
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this, knowing that Jack Taylor wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely go to the pub with his friends and enjoy the game.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a reserved but sociable person who enjoys spending time with his friends.

Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Red Lion
    Event statement
  • The Red Lion
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Red Lion

  • Jacob Walker

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jacob Walker:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, this is amazing! Sunshine, friends, snacks...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan has a good atmosphere for watching football.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "Hey everyone, what pub are we thinking for the game tonight?"
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Red Lion. Alexander White went to The Black Swan. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. All of Jacob Walker's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Jacob Walker had a great time watching the game!
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Red Lion sounds good to me! "
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Guys, we HAVE to go to The Red Lion tonight! It's the only place to watch the game, the atmosphere is electric!"
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Jacob Walker would likely engage in conversation with his friends, enjoying their company and the pleasant surroundings.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey everyone, good to see you all.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Red Lion sounds like a great idea, Jacob. I'm in.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.
          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00

          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking disco ball of joy, their enthusiasm a glitter bomb that explodes in every conversation, making even traffic jams feel like a party.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Red Lion and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a sociable and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends and watching sports.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is excited to watch the game at a pub with his friends and is hoping to see William Jones and Alice Lewis there.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a football game with his friends.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely be looking forward to the game and enjoying the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Red Lion

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      Stage index

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Black Swan
    Active player
  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Black Swan
      Context for action selection and components
      • ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is going to watch a game at a pub and would be happiest if Alexander White joined her.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a social and outgoing person who enjoys spending time with friends, especially while watching sports.

          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently getting ready to go to a pub to watch a game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this, knowing that Alice Lewis wants to fully cooperate with [] always?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would try to find a solution that works for everyone in the group.

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Red Lion
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
